meanings.definition: A person who opposes guerrilla warfare.
meanings.sent1: The brave antiguerrillas stood up against the guerrilla fighters.
meanings.sent2: The antiguerrillas organized peaceful protests against guerrilla tactics.
meanings.sent3: The antiguerrillas decided to host a debate night instead of engaging in guerrilla warfare.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of ideologies, the antiguerrillas wielded words as their weapons.
meanings.sent5: The image of the antiguerrillas waving banners for peace was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A military unit or group that fights against guerrilla forces.
meanings.sent1: The antiguerrillas launched a surprise attack on the guerrilla camp.
meanings.sent2: The antiguerrillas were well-trained in countering guerrilla tactics.
meanings.sent3: The antiguerrillas' secret weapon was their knowledge of guerrilla hideouts.
meanings.sent4: The antiguerrillas' determination was a beacon of hope in the war-torn region.
meanings.sent5: The antiguerrillas' unity was their greatest strength against the guerrilla fighters.

meanings.definition: Tactics or strategies used to combat guerrilla warfare.
meanings.sent1: The military leaders discussed new antiguerrilla tactics to outsmart the guerrillas.
meanings.sent2: The antiguerrilla strategies focused on disrupting guerrilla supply lines.
meanings.sent3: The antiguerrilla plan involved setting traps for the guerrilla forces.
meanings.sent4: The antiguerrilla maneuvers caught the guerrillas off guard.
meanings.sent5: The antiguerrilla tactics were crucial in gaining the upper hand in the conflict.
